benchmark_details.name: CaReSound
benchmark_details.overview: CaReSound is a benchmark dataset of annotated medical audio recordings enriched with metadata and paired question-answer examples, designed to drive progress in diagnostic reasoning research.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the CaReSound benchmark is to advance open-ended question-answering in health diagnostics.

data.source: The dataset is built from diverse open-source medical audio recordings, including ICBHI, KAUH, CirCor, SPRSound, and ZCHSound.
data.annotation: Generated QA pairs based on metadata and annotations via large language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions against ground truth using semantic and lexical similarity metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher BERTScore and METEOR values indicate better performance in generating semantically and contextually relevant outputs.
methodology.baseline_results: CaReAQA achieves 86.2% accuracy on open-ended diagnostic reasoning tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated via rigorous testing on multiple unseen datasets.
